admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as highly satisfactory. The impressive improvement on
            the financial performance of the telecommunications company
            (BTC) along with the government's renewed commitment to
            continued development of the telecommunications sector
            indicate that the benefits of the project are highly
            sustainable. Overall, World Bank and Borrower performances
            were adjudged satisfactory. A key lesson learned is the
            overall positive effect the Bank can have on sector
            development when the Bank is involved in all aspects of
            reform; the Bank's involvement in strengthening BTC
            gave it credibility in the sector, which permitted the Bank
            to pursue additional sectoral reforms including BTC's
            privatization. The project also showed how strong synergy
            among a country's development partners is key to
            helping borrowers and governments achieve reform objectives
            through a coordinated and consultative approach. The Bank
            succeeded in persuading the Bulgarian authorities to conform
            to the agreed tariff formula mainly due to effective
            coordination. The project's reform agenda was very
            ambitious and government changes delayed important actions.
            Targets for achieving broader reform objectives should be
            set with realistic timetables, taking into account political
            risks and implementation challenges, and these objectives
            should be adequately described in the project documents.
            Lastly, the project should have developed monitorable
            indicators for evaluating technical assistance.
